definition: to help/to assist financially
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
old variant of 幫|帮[bang1]
(of garments) against the skin/to line/lining/to contrast with/to assist financially

sentences.english: Bnd she stayed at home to take care of me and my older brother.
sentences.chinese: 她待在家里赐顾帮衬我和我哥哥。

sentences.english: She devotes all her spare time to looking after her sick mother.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有的空余时间都花在赐顾帮衬生病的母亲上。

sentences.english: B:I had to look after my son at home.
sentences.chinese: 我只患上在家里赐顾帮衬我儿子。

sentences.english: It came from the toad which the girl had cared for with such kindness.
sentences.chinese: 它来自小女孩蛤蟆赐顾帮衬如许地仁慈。

sentences.english: What will you do in the vacation? I will look after my younger sister temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 假期里你精壮什么？我将姑且赐顾帮衬我妹妹。

sentences.english: Full accommodation of each other's concerns constitutes an important basis for cooperation and dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 充实赐顾帮衬彼此关切，是对话与合作的主要前提。

sentences.english: You must take good care of themselves, the work will not be too hard.
sentences.chinese: 你必然要赐顾帮衬好本身，工作不要太负责。

sentences.english: My brother often takes care of me.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥时常赐顾帮衬我。

sentences.english: These poor children were deprived of love and proper care.
sentences.chinese: 这些怜悯的孩子被剥夺了爱及得当的赐顾帮衬。

sentences.english: There is also no brothers Qi etc. outdoor the sister, the family is assisting Chen pecuniary assistance.
sentences.chinese: 也没有兄弟姐妹外戚等，家里在帮衬资助。

sentences.english: Mother is ill, I have to look after her at home.
sentences.chinese: 母亲病了，我必须在家赐顾帮衬她。

sentences.english: You should take good care of your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该好好赐顾帮衬你的眼睛。

sentences.english: Roses need speciing care so th support they can live through winter.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰必要特殊的帮衬以便它们可以活过隆冬。

to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
